channel.title: Community on Sid Patil
channel.description: Recent content in Community on Sid Patil

item.title: Android Worldwide: January 2022
item.description: We kickstart 2022 at Android Worldwide with a two days session on January 25th & 26th. This quarter we cover different topics ranging from managing memory at multiplatform level with Kotlin, maxing out the performance of your SQLite database, implementing FTS for faster database querying and much more!

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Learn backend engineering with Ktor
item.description: Himanshu Singh convinces us why Kotlin is a viable option for backend engineering. Explore popular Kotlin backend frameworks and understand the merits of using Ktor.

item.title: Android Worldwide: July 2021
item.description: This quarter we explore simple stacks, Error handling with arrow, new activity results API, mobile devops, better gradle dependencies, shared flows in Kotlin, common code issues with KSP, new Window insets API in Android worldwide July 2021 sessions

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Multiplatform projects and server-driven UI
item.description: Build multiplatform projects with SwitfUI and compose and learn the art of server driven UI on Android with John Oreilly and Adit Lal

item.title: Uncoiling the Coil with Sagar Viradiya
item.description: Choosing an image loading library in 2021 can be a challenge. Sagar Viradiya, GDE for Android tells us why Coil is one of the best image loading libraries.

item.title: Android Worldwide: April 2021
item.description: As the second event of the series unfolds, Julien Salvi, Honey Sonwani, Marton Braun, Karan Dhillon, Mohit Sarveiya, Rikin Marfatia and Wajahat Karim talk about the latest in Android development.

item.title: Dive into Kotlin/JS with Sebastian Aigner
item.description: Let us talk about how we can use Kotlin to leverage one of the most exciting platforms of the last decade, the browser. We will see what it takes to get started with writing Kotlin JS applications.

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai x Android Worldwide
item.description: Kotlin Mumbai joins communities from around the globe for a worldwide event. Niharika Arora, Himanshu Singh and Shubrajyoti Sen take us through Kotin Flows and Joda Time!

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Exploring Future of Android UI With Jetpack Compose
item.description: Compose is a new declarative way of making user interfaces on Android. In this talk Gurupreet shares how one can quickly bootstrap a project with compose.

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Dissecting Coroutines
item.description: Mohit Sarveiya walks us through using coroutines in Kotlin and how they work under the hood. In this talk, we will explore basic to advanced features provided by the coroutines library.

item.title: Build a game with Jetpack Compose and Keep up with scoped storage on Android
item.description: In this talk Wajahat Karim, GDE for Android walks us through the basics of building a game in Jetpack Compose and Carlos Mota of GDG Coimbra teaches us more about Scoped storage.

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Building a better codebase with Lint on Android
item.description: On popular demand, the Lint API was extended to support non-Android Kotlin projects. In this talk Subhrajyoti Sen talks about using lint rules to build better codebases on Android.

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Increase Your Product Quality Through Accessibility
item.description: Senior Android Engineer at Meetup, Victoria Gonda talks about accessibility on apps and how to make it better!

item.title: Android 11 Meetup: GDG MAD and Kotlin Mumbai
item.description: GDG MAD and Kotlin Mumbai co-organize an Android 11 meetup with Google!

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: TDD using Spek
item.description: Senior Android Engineer at BYJUs, Rivu Chakraborty gives a talk on test driven development using Spek

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Github Actions!
item.description: Nicola Corti from Spotify walks us through Github actions! It is time to roll up your sleeves and make production easier!

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Kotlin basics and Flows
item.description: Filip Babic and Akshay Chordiya take us through the world of kotlin!

item.title: Kotlin Mumbai: Dagger and Jetpack Navigation
item.description: With the current situation and lockdowns due to coronavirus, we had to roll up our sleeves and prepare for a fully online meetup.
